name: 42 Macro
title: Will Tariffs Tank The US Economy?
text:
Synopsis
Despite potential tariff challenges, the US economy is expected to remain resilient, with low recession probability and potential growth moderation in the near term.

Key Insights
- President Trump confirmed 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico starting February 1
- Both Canadian and Mexican officials have hinted at potential retaliation
- The US economy has six foundational pillars maintaining its resilience
- Trade does not constitute a large enough share of US GDP to significantly disrupt economic dynamics
- The current business cycle analysis signals a low probability of recession over the medium term
- The growth reporting model now suggests growth may be in line with or slightly below consensus estimates in the next few quarters
- Five interconnected hawkish catalysts are expected to materialize this summer, which could impact market conditions
